head.title: Prologue. Written and spoken by Mr. Turnbull, at the Theatre, Dumfries. To the Heroine, A Comedy, by William Reid, Blacksmith.11 Published in Columbian Herald and New Daily Advertiser [Charleston, SC] (April 26, 1796). William Reid, Blacksmith, is not the same as the unidentified Ayrshire black-smith poet Turnbull writes about in “To a Black-Smith,” published in Poetical Essays (1788).

bling string?
If ever Poet yet was son of thine,
My laurel, crown, and scepter, I’ll resign.”
Old Vulcan frown’d, and blew his
pond’rous bellows,
Then thought on all his race of sooty
slows;
